text: Puff pastry, also known as , is a flaky light pastry made from a laminated dough composed of dough and butter or other solid fat. The butter is put inside the dough (or vice versa), making a that is repeatedly folded and rolled out before baking. It takes a long time to make. The gaps that form between the layers left by the fat melting are pushed (leavened) by the water turning into steam during the baking process. It was first made in France in the 17th century.. ==References== Category:Pastries
title: Puff pastry
